Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Reed W
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Orbitz because the hotel's own website showed no availability, but Orbitz still had rooms. I reserved a 1 bedroom suite, which was supposed to have a separate bedroom with a king size bed, plus a living room with a queen size sofa bed and kitchen. When we got to our room, it was just a basic hotel room with one king bed and a small kitchen. I called down to the front desk, and they said they were very sorry but they had no other rooms available, so all they could do is send up a roll-away bed. Once I saw what that was like, and realized we were missing an entire bedroom, I called back and asked to speak to the manager. The manager said she was terribly sorry, but they made a rare mistake, and she offered to give me the first night free, plus a discount on the second night, or help me find another hotel if we decided to move. Well, moving was just too much trouble, so we stayed both nights. The view is fantastic, the kitchen had everything we needed, and the king bed was very comfortable. We asked for a couple things (e.g., extra blanket), and they were delivered to the room promptly. We took advantage of the shuttle, which saved walking up and down the hill. It was very easy to walk to Hollywood Blvd where all the main attractions are within a few blocks of the hotel. On the last day, I asked for a late checkout, which the manager was happy to arrange. Then, on top of all that, she said she'd decided to give us a full refund for the second night as well! It is rare to find a hotel manager who really understands the value of good customer service. I could have left very disgruntled about the mixup, and posted lousy reviews, but instead the manager went out of her way to apologize for the hotel's error and to do everything she could to make it right. We will definitely return here on our next trip to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Hills Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenfnlantern
Reviews.Content: The wife and I were in town to see a few concerts on the Sunset Strip. Based on Trip Advisor reviews, we decided to try the Hollywood Hills Hotel for the central location and spectacular view of Hollywood/L.A. I've stayed in fancier hotels from New York to San Francisco, but the service and friendliness here truly exceeded our expectations. The service was 5 Star!!! Every little detail from the shuttle service to the snacks to Marcus making sure that we got the room we wanted was handled very graciously. Nick is an exemplary Concierge and handled our reservations for dinner at Yamashiro and the Magic Castle, even advising us on the best nights to go. The room itself was clean, a little beat up, but had everything you'll need for a comfortable home-base in Hollywood including a multi-million dollar view.

Reviews.Title: “An Affordable Gem!”
Reviews.Author: avideno
Reviews.Content: After living in LA for many years, I have often found that it's hard to find a great hotel to recommend to friends/visitors that is under $200/night. But finally, this is the place! At the last minute, we needed a place to stay in Hollywood near our apartment for one night. I called The Magic Castle (another GREAT place to stay in Hollywood) but they were booked and suggested their sister hotel, this one. And it was $50/night less expensive... which was perfect for us. After booking the room, the receptionist asked if we were celebrating anything, and I told her our anniversary was coming up (but honestly, I hadn't thought of celebrating it that particular night). When we arrived there was a bottle of wine with balloons, a card (hand signed and very sweet!) and a delicious little chocolate cake from Susina Bakery (a great LA bakery) waiting for us. It was unbelievably welcoming and awesome... and because of it, we decided to celebrate our anniversary that night with a nice dinner at Yamashiro! It was very romantic and fun. We never expected to have such a fun impromptu anniversary celebration! The Good: Friendly/welcoming/professional/helpful staff... everyone included! Perfect location GREAT views of the city VERY comfortable new bed with good/soft linens/comforter (no old style bedspreads with scratchy sheets here) Large room/suite with kitchenette/living room area with couch/chair Large balcony with table 24-hour heated pool Yamashiro (restaurant and bar) is right up the stairs Magic Castle is on the same property Easy parking ($11/day) Secure (gate w/ code) and safe feeling Sparkling Lemonade "welcome drink" in champagne glasses upon check-in Late check-out was available... I checked out at 12:30 which was helpful The Bad: Nothing! The Average: The room has a bit of "shabbiness" to it... some chipped paint, and a few imperfections. The decor isn't fancy or fabulous... BUT we did not care one bit because the service/location/view was worth so much more. The decor was easy to get over since we were enjoying the experience so much. This hotel is an excellent value for the money... especially in Los Angeles, where affordable hotels in this price range are really hard to find.

Reviews.Title: “Little Apartment”
Reviews.Author: theheatonfamily
Reviews.Content: Older property but comfortable enough. Little apartment with small full kitchen, living room and large bedroom. Check in at the Magic Castle, down the hill. Great staff, continental breakfast, secure parking, dvd loan, snacks and a chance to visit the Magic Castle Club next door - very fun!! Very close to Hollywood Blvd and all the activities there.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location and roomy.”
Reviews.Author: girltravelme
Reviews.Content: Lovve this hotel for its location and great rooms. I stay here every time I come to LA. I usually walk everywhere and you don;t need to spend hundreds on cabs if u stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: Chris11599
Reviews.Content: Completely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting LA. The location in Hollywood is perfect, it really is only 5 minutes from the Hollywood Blvd and yet absolutely quiet. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable, we paid a bit more for the view and it was well worth it. Decor is slightly faded, but the space made up for it (massive and comfy bed, by the way). Great pool, not heated but attractively landscaped and quiet. The short walk down to breakfast was no problem, and the choice of food available was good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, great view, fabulous location, incredible staff.”
Reviews.Author: Tara M
Reviews.Content: Wow, we just returned from California and what a great find the Hollywood Hills Hotel was. Safe neighborhood just steps off Hollywood Blvd and the Walk of Fame, Grauman's Chinese Theater, etc. A little tricky to find but well worth it. It is the sister to the Magic Castle Hotel and is up a steep hill which you can drive to and park with secure guaranteed parking, walk to, or get a shuttle ride up to. The Magic Castle Hotel itself is a little pricier but very nice looking with nice pool and apparently big suites. The Hollywood Hills Hotel is a step down in quality but still very decent. Really it is a bank of small apartments, some of which are still rented as apartments, some as rooms. Since it was a quarter mile up in the Hollywood Hills, the view was magnificent from our large balcony in the one bedroom suite. Kingsize bed, good size bathroom/double sinks, foldout double sofa, table/chairs, kitchenette with dishes, microwave, fridge, TV's in living room and bedroom. Not huge and not fancy, but homey and nice, everything working, clean, quiet and comfy. Then there is the staff. By far the nicest, friendliest, well informed staff I can ever remember. They will help you find things, get places, stay late, park easier, and just make your stay so much better. Complimentary sodas, snacks and candy are available - just ask and they fill a bag for you. They packed us a bag to take to Universal Studios and several times just to take up to the room. Hot cider and cookies in the lobby in the evening and nice continental breakfast in the morning. Check in, snacks, breakfast, free DVD loan are all done at the Magic Castle Hotel down the hill. MCH pool is heated and HHH is not, so we were invited to swim down there, as well. We did ask for a ride up the hill once and they couldn't have been nicer. Also, by staying there, you can attend a dinner show or brunch show at the Magic Castle, otherwise you have to be a Magic Castle Member (a magician!) Brunch is the only time kids can attend and coat/tie is not mandatory. The food and shows were fabulous and the hotel staff let us leave the car in their lot. Best staff ever encountered and love this place! Will try Magic Castle Hotel itself next opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vronne B
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research on the internet my Son & I stayed here for 1 week at the beginning of our holiday then travelled to other parts of the US, then went back for another 4 nights towards the end of our holiday (Lisa had left a personal note, a bottle of drink & lollies to welcome us back- how sweet). This place is fantastic, the staff are amazing & very good looking (another bonus), the view is spectacular (I was in room 504), free snacks daily and a lovely free continental breakfast daily around the pool. Next time I'm in town I will stay here again. Thank you to all the staff for making our stay wonderful. I wish I was there right now! Vronne from Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Average room, outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: Iain C
Reviews.Content: We did a fair bit of research before deciding on the Hollywood Hills hotel. We stayed 3 nights while we did a quick stopover on our way back to Australia from Florida. The good: Fantastic service. Nick, the guy at the desk, was truly a font of knowledge on the local attractions. Helped me with booking a day tour that turned out to be brilliant. He explained how the hotel worked, that we could get free mini-bar snacks and soft drinks and about the included buffet breakfast in the morning. All the other staff were also friendly and helpful. Breakfast in the mornings is awesome and sets you up for the day. The average: The rooms could do with a bit of a spruce up. There was mould in our bathroom and the room was pretty smelly, stuffy and hot. The small air conditioner didn't really do much to help so we ended up having to keep all the doors open which isn't ideal. Some new carpets and a split-system airconditioner would help. That said, the room was ample in size for our family of 4. There is a separate room for the master bedroom and a pull out sofa. As our kids are older we bought an air bed and sheets at the local Target for our son to sleep on (too old to share with sis :0)). The pool area was teriffic and the views of the city from the balcony superb. There is a shuttle bus up and down from the sister hotel (Magic Castle) for breakfast if you want it. We just walked which only takes 5 mins at the most (no wonder the yanks are obese if they can't take a small walk up and down a hill). The location is great, you can easily walk to Hollywood Blvd for the nightlife, star walk and city tours. Plenty of places to eat also within walking distance. Would I stay here again? 50/50 on that one. The place was nice enough, but could do with some TLC so I'd have to think carefully about it.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Staff, Fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: RichSikes
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best places we've stayed in many years of traveling. It's hard to explain, because it's dated and a little worn around the edges. It has the atmosphere (and some furnishings) of something from the Rat Pack era of the 60's. but is still fairly nice and it exhibits a lot of class from it's glory days. Extreme value, the staff is really nice and helpful. Our spacious balcony-effeciency had a view of Hollywood and LA like from a postcard. The Yamashirio is a very classy old school Japanese restuarant that was fantastic and romantic, and it is right next door. After a few days, we felt more like Hollywood apartment dwellers than just staying at a hotel. The breakfast (especially the coffee) was great. The cucumber ice water and snacks in the afternoons was a refreshing relief. It is very convenient to tons of famous attractions in Beverly Hills and Hollywood. The pool with the Japanese pagota is beautiful. The Ritz it is not, but because of the relaxing atmosphere above the bustle of Hollywood, as well as the first class staff, I don't know if there is a better way to experience LA, on a budget than a stay at the Hollywood Hills.

Reviews.Title: “Above it all”
Reviews.Author: SublimeSeeker
Reviews.Content: After much research, I chose this hotel as it was nearby to where one of our sons was living. We used it as a base of operations on either side of a road trip to the San Francisco area. Because our other son was traveling with us, we opted for the suite to begin with. We booked another suite (one floor higher) on our return to Hollywood. Then, when our son flew home before us, downsized to a smaller room. So, we got a good sampling of what they offer. Customer service is a priority with this hotel, and everyone I dealt with . . . from initial booking, to the front desk, to the air conditioning mechanic, to the shuttle driver were all very pleasant and helpful. Being separated from the Magic Castle Hotel, at the foot of the hill, was not a problem. Although we had our own rental car, we often used the shuttle for breakfast, or when we walked into the heart of Hollywood. The shuttle was ready when we were. The swimming pool was a plus . . . located in a remote section of this hillside retreat, it was gated as was the entire hillside compound. Well-maintained, it provided relief from the hot temperatures. My major gripe, was the level of building maintenance common to all rooms. Windows that didn't lock . . . same with a slider. Domestic water temperatures that were excessively hot, and were reported but not sure if they were fixed because of our short time in each room. Areas that needed caulking and painting. Overall, we would stay here again as the viewpoint of the city from the hillside gave us a feeling of place. From our balcony, we could see the Griffith Observatory, downtown L.A., the Capitol Records building, and a good portion of Hollywood. From our third floor suite we could see half of the Hollywood sign. We were in good company, at that altitude, as we were on the same level as many of our Hollywood Hill neighbors . . .beautiful homes perched on the hillside.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff at front desk was the Best ever!”
Reviews.Author: William K
Reviews.Content: Loved our 8 night stay.Great location,minutes from Hollywood blvd.Front desk staff The Best! We had problems with our rental car and girl at front desk made them bring us another car instead of losing time returning it to LAX. You can't beat the value for the location.If staying in rooms on top of the hill,you can park your car in the Hotels street level garage and walk,saving yourself the $10 parking fee that you will pay everywhere in Hollywood.Rooms are very clean.Loved our Bed.the comforter was awesome.Enjoyed some relaxing time in the pool with a great view of the city.Take an evening and visit the Japanese restaurant at the top of the hill.It is beautiful.It was nice to start the day with with the hotels continental breakfast,another money saver in a very expensive Hollywood.I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great snacks”
Reviews.Author: Joycebl
Reviews.Content: Hollywood Hills Hotel is managed by the hotel on Franklin Ave. called The Magic Castle Hotel. You check into The Magic Castle Hotel and drive or take their shuttle a minute or two up the hill behind the Castle Hotel to the apartment complex. The complex has permanent residents living in it and some apartments are used as hotel suites. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment for three nights. The furniture and appliances were a little dated, but everything was clean and the price was great for a major city. There is an unheated, very nice pool in the apt. complex and then a heated pool that is open 24 hours a day at the Magic Castle, available to guests of the Hollywood Hills. A simple continental breakfast is complimentary and served at the Magic Castle Hotel as well. But the feature most loved by my children were the snacks; the desk clerk hands out menu sheets listing all of the snacks you can request and guests can ask for candy, chips and soft drinks as often as they like. The hotel is located in the heart of Hollywood, one block from Grauman's Theater, the Walk of Fame, Hollywood and Highland complex, and The El Capitain Theater. Beverly Hills and Rodeo Drive are a short drive away as is the Paramount Studios. We found the location to be quite convenient to most of the sites we wanted to visit. Be sure to drive up into the hills behind the hotel (Mullholland Drive) to see great views of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again next time we're in LA”
Reviews.Author: e2006
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Hills Hotel was an excellent and affordable place to stay in West Hollywood. It is affiliated with the Magic Castle Hotel (shares a front desk and breakfast area), but the rooms are located up a hill and offer a significant amount of privacy for a hotel. The staff will drive you up if you don't want to walk, as well as shuttle you to nearby locations. The pool is beautiful (beats the ones we've lounged by on the sunset strip) and the room we stayed in had a great view of LA. An added perk - munchies (granola bars, cheeze-its, oreos) and drinks (iced tea, soda, etc) were all free - all we had to do was ask the front desk! The front desk was extremely friendly and accommodating throughout our stay. We intended to stay just one night but decided to stay an additional night after scoring free tickets to the baseball game. The room was clean, large, and had a great little balcony we drank coffee on in the morning. The only problem we had with the room was the first night; while the AC worked, we felt heat blasting through the wall vent. I waited until the morning to call about it and they sent a maintenance man to take care of it right away.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel - great find!”
Reviews.Author: DaveHWorcester_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and loved it. The welcome we received when we checked in was very warm and friendly and made us feel at home straight away. Only a ten minute walk from the hustle and bustle of Hollywood Boulevard, the hotel was a quiet and secluded retreat after a long day exploring LA. We booked a 'city view' room which had a fantastic panaramic view of the Hollywood hills, Hollywood itself and the skyscrapers of Downtown LA in the distance. Some aspects of the room itself were maybe a little dated if you are bothered about that sort of thing, but everywhere was clean, and the size of the room, the location, and the staff, who could not do enough for us, more than made up for this. Sitting on the balcony with a glass of wine, taking in that amazing view, we could almost kid ourselves we were a resident of Hollywood, rather than a guest in a hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice room but slightly dated - no WIFI in room”
Reviews.Author: Helenww
Reviews.Content: Very nice stay at the Hollywood Hills Hotel, only downside was that the room had no wifi but the website states internet available. Cabled internet available in room and free wifi at the Magic Castle Hotel where buffet breakfast and reception is held. Location was brilliant as less than a 10 minute walk to the Kodak Theatre and the Hollywood Highland metro station. Metro train was good value for money and only two stops down from universal studios. You must check in at the Magic Castle Hotel as there is no such service where the accommodation is based which is up a steep hill . Hotel looked dated from the outside but the rooms where large and clean and came with a small kitchen. Parking provided at a reasonable fee of $10 a day. Quiet at night to sleep and enjoyed the use of the pool which was good size and came with equipment to play with. There is a 24 hour shuttle to and from the magic castle hotel at the bottom of the hill but near lunch time it may be unavailable as the staff go out to buy breakfast for the following day. The staff where very helpful and can book tickets for places like universal studios where they had a discount offer. Unlimited supply of can drinks and snacks from reception which saved us from buying as much when out.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Hollywood hotel - sweet deal!”
Reviews.Author: RosaPecosa
Reviews.Content: I love finding hidden gems! HHH is situated on the hill between The Magic Castle and Yamashiro in a spot close enough to fully experience all that Hollywood has to offer without having to listen to it all day and night. The pool is lovely, quiet and clean (bonus pagoda!) and the room made my friends and I feel like we had a little apartment in the hills. Comfy beds, great balcony (that view!) and a kitchen with a fridge, stove and stocked with dinnerware and utensils really made us feel right at home. The staff was incredibly nice and helpful to boot and offered a shuttle to get you up and down the hill if you wanted to walk into Hollywood. Loved it! I'll be back soon! (3 adult female guests, 2 nights, 1 car)

Reviews.Title: “Besides the view . . . not worth it at all”
Reviews.Author: Denver-Rosie
Reviews.Content: A sister hotel of the Magic Castle? Really. There is a good view and the free snacks are the same deal that one gets at the Magic Castle and the staff - same as the Magic Castle are wonderful. And that's where it stops. Yes, it is less expensive and the price point has been set based on it's short comings. However --- if you are use to fine hotels like the Magic Castle - you will not be happy at the Hollywood Hills. Don't do it.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good place; but needs a minor fix”
Reviews.Author: Writer/Director
Reviews.Content: I'm a loyal and gung-ho fan of the HHH and usually stay here when in Hollywood. You can't beat the view, the bed, the location... But I must admit that the mildew stains (I'm sure it isn't actual mildew, but the stains left over from scrubbing it so hard forever), the constant smell of gas in the kitchen (that they say isn't a gas leak), the flaking/chipping paint on the balcony and certain areas... well, it's beginning to irritate me. I mean, over the years I've been staying there, they've had plenty of time to do some minor renovations (really, just minor ones). Replace a curtain if it's torn, or re-caulk the tiles in the bathroom. Things like that. But, nope. Nothing's really changed. It always looks the same. A little worn, but with a pretty view. Kind of like Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “A different kind of Hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: JMB351C
Reviews.Content: The rooms are actually a portion of an apartment complex. We rented a one bedroom King unit. It had a full kitchen with eating area, separate bedroom, and a very nice deck with view of the city. It is an older facility with signs of wear (mildew in bathroom - draperies worn and drooping) but was otherwise very clean. The bed was very comfortable. Units have high speed wired Internet in the living room area. You have use of the pool facilities and can attend the Magic Castle private club as a perk for renting. Very helpful staff. One quirk; you check in at the Magic Castle Hotel at the bottom of the hill. The apartment complex is up on the hill above and is not set up for pedestrian access. There is free parking near the units but if you want to walk down the hill into the Hollywood Boulevard area, which is just one block south, you need to call the front desk for a ride down the hill. Stop at the front desk to get a ride back up the hill.

Reviews.Title: “Most affordable view!”
Reviews.Author: YK-Northernlights
Reviews.Content: Upon checking in for a 5 night stay our room had not been occupied for some time it had seemed. The apartment/suite was dusty and had to kill about a dozen spiders which were mostly on the ceiling corners. We called the front desk and advised them and the next day the room was spotless, we were also generously comped and treated to a buffet of leftover goodies left in our room by the housekeeper after each day that we got back from our daily activities. The view is priceless and right behind is the Yamashiro castle which we loved walking up to each night and looking out at the city. As you drive up to your hotel it has a coded gate which adds a sense of security especially if you are parking a nice pricey sports car in your very own designated spot. There is a continental B-Fast down at the base hotel(Magic Castle Hotel)in morning which isn't spectacular yet the staff try their best to please which more than makes for any of the faults you may experience during your stay. A big thank you to the staff for pampering us!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service at its FINEST!”
Reviews.Author: jlcrawford
Reviews.Content: Its apparent from the time you register that Hollywood Hills wants your return visit! Customer satisfaction is # 1, and they go out of their way to be courteous, accomodating, and show genuine interest in EACH guest! Shan, (front desk supervisor) , ALWAYS made you feel welcomed, and is the sort of front desk supervisor that you should find at every hotel. He is an ASSET to the Hollywood Hills hotel! Each day he would ask if there was anything we needed to make our stay complete! Eleven adults reunited for a 60th birthday celebration and the Hollywood Hills management made it a memorable reunion! To all those whom I have not personally thanked, please know that your representation of the hotel is unsurpassed! I give the highest recommendation to those who will be visiting this area!

Reviews.Title: “AAA++++ service”
Reviews.Author: zoegirl06
Reviews.Content: The staff at this Hotel truly works Magic. Every person I came in contact with went above and beyond the expected services to make our group of 12 as welcome as possible. The location is quiet with a fabulous view of the city, a beautiful pool area and is very clean. The only reason I could not truthfully give the 5 rating is due to the property needing to be updated with Wi-fi in the rooms and other basic upgrades in decor. They are up front and tell you that when making a reservation. With the superb staff and quiet location I felt I could overlook a little bit of peeling paint.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, gorgeous views, great location”
Reviews.Author: BitsyBooper
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. My husband and I stayed here a couple of years ago, and when we decided to spend a weekend in LA with some friends recently, I recommended this hotel. We all had a great stay. The staff is so friendly, the free snacks and breakfast are a real treat, the shuttle from the Magic Castle Hotel up the hill to the HHH runs 24 hours and the view from the rooms is spectacular. Be sure to visit the pool. It's not heated, but it's lovely and secluded up there, and it's nice to sit and chat or get some sun. On our first stay here, my husband had a toothache at 2 a.m., and the staff brought him some pain reliever right away. This time we needed to leave the car for a few hours after checking out, and they let us park in the underground garage all day for free. I can't wait to go back to Hollywood so I can stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: mlb1310
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in several hotels in Los Angeles, and this was the best ever! We (couple with 2 year old) stayed for three nights in December and we loved every minute. The staff was wonderful and helpful. We felt welcome from the minute we arrived. We stayed in one of the hillside suites and the view of the city is beyond comparison. The suite (and balcony ) was very big and comfy. The bed was great and we loved the bathtub/shower combo. We recommend this place to everyone going to Los Angeles - we will definently be back!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular view, room was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: LoveCalifornia1313
Reviews.Content: Recently got back from a trip to California which started in San Francisco and ended in LA.I booked this hotel online at a good price, thinking by the look of the picture I was getting an amazing deal. It was not as nice as it looked in the picture.It was more like a motel inside. The room was large with a kitchenette. The small tube t.v. was a little disappointing, but for as much time as one spends in a hotel, it was fine. The bathroom needed a coat of paint, to cover stains and old baseboards that were separated and had old dust gathered on the cracks in them. The vanity was made of peeling particle board, and the floor was stained, all of which was esthetic, but appeared to be clean. The bed was very comfortable, and the view was stunning from the room. I think that was made the room acceptable.The staff was very nice, friendly and eager to help out, some of the best service we had on this trip. The pool and garden were beautiful as well. My only other complaint would be the Yamashiro restaurant. I would not eat there again. It was convenient for anyone staying at the hotel but the food was average at best. Our salads were soaked in a disappointing dressing which weighed heavily on the vinegar, and the green salad was simply put, boring. The sushi rolls were disappointing as well. The Darth Vader roll had an average thousand island dressing on it, and the tempura had little flavour. This restaurant made me want to go back to our room and cook. The restaurant was overpriced, but the service was good. Its such a beautiful historic building in which the restaurant is located, that this restaurant needs to do better.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, beautiful view, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: chanileb
Reviews.Content: This hotel exceeded all of our expectations! When we arrived we were welcomed with a champagne toast and a very friendly staff. Our room was very nice and the view from our large balcony was outstanding. There is a very nice Japanese restaurant next to the hotel also with an outstanding city lights view. The location was perfect to get around anywhere hollywood. The hotel is a little bit older (as are most things in the hollywood hills) but it was still very well maintained and clean. We enjoyed our experience very much and will definitely be back in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Great - but ...”
Reviews.Author: Bruce095
Reviews.Content: Still haven't found the perfect hotel in LA but this was definitely not a bad choice - but you must have the full picture:- It feels like being in an apartment block which is probably because that's what it is/was - I think some of the rooms are still privately owned. The rooms are big (huge by British standards) - but are definitely a little worn around the edges. They are not stylish and not glamorous. Our room safe was also broken which was annoying. If you are happy with the above then you will enjoy your stay. We drove down to the Magic Castle and had our breakfast there which was great. The view we had was superb - part city/part Hollywood Hills which was perfect for me. As I was suffering jet lag the balcony was ideal - I watched the sunrise every morning. This is a great hotel in a excellent location. It is not glamorous but you will not feel ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Lyleandbek
Reviews.Content: This place has the best service you will find anywhere, where else do you get endless snacks of your choice and all you can eat breakfast, wi Fi and even laundry detergent. May not be the best rooms you ever stay in but the amazing service and extras make up for it. Is clean and very close to walk of fame etc. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I would up this to a 10 star place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: salandmarie
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this facility and I cannot say enough about the staff and the oh so many extras. Have you ever heard of a hotel that gives you a wonderful continental breakfast,snacks whenever you want them or detergent to wash your clothes? The accommodations are wonderful and everyone is so helpful. The pools are so clean as are the rooms. We hope to visit again next year. A very enjoyable experience. Thank you Gretchen, Zeeshan, Lori, Justin, et al. A special thanks to Darren Ross. GM.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & staff but room is from the 70s & buggy”
Reviews.Author: advntr7
Reviews.Content: Overall, we loved our stay at the HHH in July for 2 nights. The pool, the view, the overall facilities were great, and the staff (front desk including manager) were the best that I have ever encountered in all my years of traveling. If I were ever to return to Hollywood, I would stay here again and it would be because the staff made me feel like family. They were phenomenal. The ugly side to the stay was the condition of the room. There were silverfish around the carpet/tile, the bathroom was overall needing new caulking, etc, the drape was falling down, there was streamer/tape from previous party still up, etc. It wasn't so much that it wasn't clean, it was just very outdated and not welcoming. However, it was clean. The A/C wasnt working and the staff said that we could move to a different room but we figured it wasnt worth the hassle. We hated paying for parking - change that policy! I would recommend to ask for the NICEST room on the hill if you stay at HHH but if you want a very nice room stay at the bottom of the hill at their sister hotel Magic Castle. Overall, I'd stay here again in a heartbeat. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem. This place is totally cool...”
Reviews.Author: Dh20
Reviews.Content: Hidden gem. This place is totally cool. From the great staff (especially Hallie May) to the great views of downtown LA and Hollywood, nevermind the huge balcony and spacious rooms...did I forget to mention the comfortable beds and quilt blanket. There is also a long Japanese history with this place that is very intriguing. It is a 5 minute walk to Hollywood blvd and the staff will shuttle you up and down the hills upon request. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “We felt like family”
Reviews.Author: ABQTRAVELER_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after looking into several places close to the Hollywood bowl. They have let this wonderful hideaway age gracefully. Some would say it needs serious remodeling, but then I would say they have missed out on the charm and historical significance. We were treated like royalty. Romantic and relaxing with a staff that constantly amazed us with their help and super friendly attitude. We are looking for a reason to come back as soon as possible. The place caught us completely off-guard with it's charm and grace. Best staff ever encountered. Price was not high, not low. Worth every penny. Close to everything Hollywood. Quiet too. Incredible view.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to settle in, but worth bearing with it.”
Reviews.Author: DaveC64
Reviews.Content: I actually booked a room at the Magic Castle hotel, which is run by the same people as the Hollywood Hills hotel, but there was a problem with my booking and I got moved here. It's a "sister" hotel that's a 5 minute walk away and borrows some of the Magic Castle's services. At first I was pretty annoyed. Instead of the bright, family friendly Magic Castle I'd booked, I found myself climbing a very steep, dark hill up to this place, which appears to be mostly residential apartments, and those that aren't filled with permanent tenants are used as hotel rooms. It has a coded security gate at the entrance, but the actual room security is pretty poor. The room smelled of gas, and the air con was incredibly loud. I was fairly unhappy by the time I settled in (I called the desk to ask to be moved but was denied). Then I looked out of the window (of room 504) and the view immediately made up for a significant part of that unhappiness. On a clear day you can see the Griffiths observatory, the corner of Hollywood and Highland, and Downtown LA in the distance. It's a really great view, and when the sun came up, the hotel suddenly started to feel a lot more secure, nestled in the hills amongst the typical Hollywood houses and the Yamashiro restaurant next door. As it's run by the Magic Castle, you get use of their free breakfast, their free "mini bar" (you have to go to their front desk to collect items), their pool and their mostly lovely staff. That's a definite plus, but as I say - I wanted to be in the Magic Castle, not a 5 minute walk away. Worth noting that there's no internet at the hotel, you need to walk down to the Magic Castle's pool area if you want that. The location is pretty handy though, as it's a short walk down the steep hill to Hollywood Boulevard, which meant it was easy to get to the Chinese theatre before the crowds turned up. If you do stay here, bear in mind you can use your pool key to get through the lower car exit gate which saves a lot of hill walking. The pool (separate to Magic Castle's pool) is very pretty, themed after the Yamashiro restaurant, but quite busy and loud (the residents were playing music there for most of our stay - if you like Alkaline Trio you'll be OK here). The car parking is awkward, but safe and easy to access (costs $10 a night though). My main gripe is that there's a few factors that eat away at my ability to sleep here - the door locks feel loose and the doors rattle in their fittings at night; the air con is insanely loud at times; the fridge buzzed like crazy; the room smelled funny - if only the place had a bit more attention maintenance and security wise, it would have been a fantastic stay. As it is, it's a mix of terrible and awesome elements that ends up about average.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful service! Great location.”
Reviews.Author: ScorpiogirlVancouver
Reviews.Content: My teenage son and I recently stayed at the Hollywood Hills Hotel which is affiliated with the Magic Castle Hotel. You check in and eat breakfast at the Magic Castle Hotel as the rooms of the Hollywood Hills Hotel are up the hill and some of the property are residential apartments. When we arrived we were greeted with a cool drink and instantly made to feel very welcome. We had a studio room with a kitchenette with a lovely view of the Hollywood Hills. The room itself was on the older side but it was quiet and spacious. The walk down to the Magic Castle Hotel took 7 minutes (and I'm not a particularly fast walker) but it is quite steep. We never did walk up as there was always someone able to drive us up to our room. We never waited longer than a couple of minutes for a ride and this was at all sorts of different times of the day including after 10:00 pm. The continental breakfast was great, including yogurt, cereals, toast, croissants, scones and muffins. There were a number of juices and tea, coffee and instant hot chocolate. Definitely a big cut above the average. The Magic Castle is located a block and a half from Hollywood Boulevard. Once you are on Hollywood Boulevard you turn left and right there is Madame Tussauds and a bit beyond in the same block is the Chinese Theatre and the Kodak Theatre. Madame Tussauds was amazing and the half hour tour of the Kodak Theatre was certainly worth doing. In the area in front of the Kodak Theatre there are a number of stands with numerous brochures, with lots of information about attractions, some with coupons for the local attractions. There is also a manned Information Centre there on the left hand side as you are facing the theatre. The entrance to the theatre is actually quite far back from the street past a number of shops and the box office for tour tickets for the Kodak Theatre is located there. One other attraction which we thought was wonderful was the Hollywood History Museum. It had a huge collection of Marilyn Monroe memorabilia and so much more. It is on Highland just off Hollywood Boulevard and again really worth seeing. One more thing, we loved our tour of Warner Brothers Studio, especially our tour guide Andy K. We had dinner at Yamashiro, which is just above the Hollywood Hills Hotel. The view from the restaurant is beautiful and expansive and it is not too expensive if you watch which entrees you order. The Magic Hotel staff made the reservation for us and imagine our surprise and pleasure when we were served a free appetizer compliments of the Magic Castle! One other thing about the hotel as that they had a list of goodies, snacks and soft drinks that you could have by simply going to the front desk and requesting some. My son (and I!) really loved this, particulary at the end of a long day exploring Hollywood. I can't say enough about the staff at the Magic Castle Hotel. They were all so pleasant and helpful, especially Lisa, Zishon (spelling?) and Karen. We look forward to returning some time in the (hopefully) not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VIEW! GREAT STAFF!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyCochran
Reviews.Content: Great view! wasnt expecting it when i looked out. Great staff, at check in and check out! Parking is a lil weird but its cool. You check in at the Magic Castle down below which looked to be a great place also. I will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay on the Hill”
Reviews.Author: AcmeRocket55
Reviews.Content: We decided to come up to Hollywood from San Diego to get away and see some taping of shows. I looked online at all the different hotels. I've read horror stories of different hotel but thought I would give this one a shot. To my surprise and great satisfaction my choice to stay at this hotel was spot-on. The room was very clean, the bed was very very comfortable and the flat screen TV was a super plus. The room was decorated with pictures of movie stars and out the rear window I could see the giant Hollywood sign on the hill. I must say our stay was great. Oh yeah... If you're looking for a coffee maker, microwave and fridge just slide open the left side of the closet. We found that on the last day. I would and will recommend this hotel to everyone. And it is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Room, Fantastic View, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: sbs74
Reviews.Content: We live in the Hollywood Hills and are remodeling. Needing a place to stay for a couple of nights, we ended up at the Hollywood Hills Hotel. It is a dump. With the outside temperature over 100 degrees, the room heater would not shut off and the small bedroom air conditioner barely worked. There were other uncharming attributes to the room. However, the staff of the Magic Castle/ Hollywood Hills Hotel(s) -- they are jointly run with a single check in office -- was fabulous. They could teach many superior places how to handle problems. Although we will not recommend this place, we will recommend the service, the attitude and the manager's equitable solution. And, the view is stupendous.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Escape!!!”
Reviews.Author: thrilln2travelers
Reviews.Content: What a thrill it was to stay in this old hollywood style hideaway! Hidden in the hills of Hollywood, this hotel is remarkable. The view from our room was breathtaking. The pool is magnificant. The Continental Breakfast at the Magic Castle was "Delish". We especially enjoyed the scones! This hotel's biggest asset is their staff. The staff was more than helpful, and pleasant to deal with. No request was denied. Gretchen and Marcus were gracious and resourceful to recommend restaurants in the area. Even making reservations for us while we were on the road, so that when we got to the Hotel all was set! A shuttle service up and down the hill from your room to the Magic Castle is provided if necessary. Every staff member we interacted with was fun, cheerful and easy to deal with. They make you feel like a Celebrity! We definitely will make this place a yearly escape.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden retreat amid the bustle of Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: WanderingVeggie
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Hills Hotel is a treat. It is paired with the Magic Castle Hotel, which is where you check in and eat breakfast. This hotel is located in the steep, curving hills of the Hollywood Heights neighborhood, about two blocks north of Hollywood Boulevard. The scenery is gorgeous, as is the pool. The grounds at HHH are well tended, with walkways, waterfalls, lush greenery and stonework. Our room had a view of the hills to the east, with some wealthy neighbors nearby and the Griffith Observatory a little farther away. At the top of the driveway, there is a fantastic view of the Hollywood sign, very close compared to the view from Griffith Park, which is where many people seem to go to see it. The service was excellent. The staff was very helpful and friendly and provided us with free minibar snacks when we arrived tired and hungry. Normally, minibar snacks are $1. The breakfast selection was large and tasty. Fresh fruit that has been washed, scones, muffins, croissants, bread, yogurt, granola, hot and cold cereal, juice, milk, coffee (and flavor shots), tea. You have to go down to the Magic Castle Hotel to eat. The walk is lovely and safe â€“ and steep. Rides are available, too, but we only used those to get back up the hill a couple of times when we were very tired or in a hurry. The pool at the HHH was big and beautiful, particularly when compared to the little bitty pool at the Magic Castle Hotel. The HHH pool is not heated, but the one at Magic Castle is. Depending on the time of year you're going, it wouldn't matter. We were there in July, and the water was quite warm. Our room: big. Inside the front door was the small kitchen and living room. The fridge/freezer (small, but not dorm-sized) was cold when we arrived. There was a pull-out sofa, coffee table, end tables, dining table and chairs, and entertainment center. Sliding glass doors led to the balcony, which was the length of the room. The balcony was rather narrow, however. Two glass doors with cellular shades separated the bedroom from the living room. The bedroom had two double beds, nightstand, dresser, chair, and closet. Another patio door leading to the balcony was off the bedroom. The bathroom was located off the bedroom. The bath had two sinks and a shower/tub combo with room at the back to sit or store your stuff. A hair dryer was provided. There was more than ample storage space for toiletries and beach towels. Shampoo was provided, even enough for us with lots of hair. Also provided were conditioner, bar soap, facial cleanser, body wash, and some other girly stuff that I can't remember. The linens and towels were very white and the beds were comfy. The housekeeping staff fluffed the pillows in a decorative way, which was a fun touch. I wouldn't say the room was cleaned to perfection every day, but we were there for five nights, and whatever dirt was in the corner of the bathroom was definitely ours. Some miscellany: The room was air conditioned, and the AC was not loud, which was nice. It was a quiet place, except when people came back to their rooms at night and chatted (or laughed or yelled) on the walk to their rooms. Parking was odd. The driveway and parking areas are quite narrow and twisty-turny, so you definitely need to pay attention. Parking spaces are assigned and are not necessarily across from your room. Internet is only available at the Magic Castle Hotel down the hill, which I wasn't crazy about, but it forced me to do things rather than get caught up in emails, facebook, etc. It would have been nice, though, to be able to double-check directions online or check traffic updates (sigalert.com--very useful) before we left. Definitely go to Yamashiro Restaurant up the hill. The sushi was fantastic, and their desserts are heavenly. Any attire is acceptable. We saw people in shorts, jeans, and evening wear. Even my 15-year-old who is convinced the whole world is watching (and criticizing) her felt comfortable there. In all, this was a great place. It's an old Hollywood hotel with real charm and homey elegance. I had looked at other places closer to Hollywood Blvd. for similar cost, and I'm glad we chose this place. After you've walked down Hollywood Blvd. once, you don't really need to ever again. It's busy and loud and crowded and fun, but it's definitely a been-there, done-that experience, so being away from the noise and people was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: KR_EDINBURGH
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and really enjoyed the location as our base in LA. Views from our balcony were excellent, combining both hill and city scapes. We had a 1 bed apartment, and it was spacious. Breakfast is 10 mins walk down the road at the Magic Castle, quite basic but fresh and tasty. Wifi in Magic Castle but not in apartments (free) Staff friendly and helpful, would stay again. Pool looked nice but unfortunately not cleaned up so couldnt use it.

Reviews.Title: “A true Hollywood secret”
Reviews.Author: travelinvasion
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy the Hollywood Hills Hotel. Appearing to be the step sister to the Magic Castle Hotel below, this place has a great location and relaxing vibe. The one bedroom apartments are worth the extra few dollars over the studio units. My last visit was booked only a few days before arrival so we ended up with the last room available which wasn't bad. Room 112 had a view of the surrounding hillside and a slight view of Hollywood below. The patio decks are a great way to unwind. The staff can't be beat and service all around is top notch. The free breakfast is satisfying. The best part though is the pool area. Very lightly used and a very Zen like experience. The location is close to everything in Hollywood. Due to the elevation and terrain, this is probably not the best hotel for the disabled. My only complaints this time were the lack of drinking glasses in the room and a few weird objects underneath the bed. Otherwise this is a perfect place for a retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: doubtfire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood hills hotel for just 1 night on our way back from French Polynesia. Initially picked it for its location as it was near Hollywood Boulevard and the attractions. The check in was easy and our room was ready straight away. We had a hire car so going up the hill was no problem or was parking as you had an alloted car parking space. The room was big and although a little dated it was clean with decent air con and a kitchenette particularly useful if you are on flydrive or a longer stay in LA. There was a large balcony with great views over LA and hollywood hills. Just near to our room was a roof swimming pool that has recently been renovated and had we had more time would have been a lovely to relax- very quiet and peaceful. There was a complimentary continental breakfast served in the magic castle hotel at the bottom of the hill- all you really need- pastries,cereal, biscuits, coffee, tea. You could also use the pool at the magic castle hotel. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful in pointing out restaurants, attractions. If you wanted a lift up or down the hill anytime all you had to do was call and they would pick you up or drop you off- especially useful in the evening when going out for dinner. The hotel is about a 5 min walk from the chinese theatre and walk of fame as well as a large modern shopping centre with good restaurants inside. We thought this hotel was good value for LA and in an ideal locaion- Universal studios -5 mins as well as warners brothers studio. It is about a 10 mins drive to Beverly Hills and Rodeo drive- definately worth a drive through.

Reviews.Title: “This is the Hidden Gem of L.A”
Reviews.Author: Matju
Reviews.Content: We stayed in L.A for a couple of days and we choose this hotel after great reviews and we were not disapointed. The staff was sooo helpful, the room was amazing, we had a great view of the Hollywood sign and L.A. The hotel is a walking distance from all the main hollywood attraction. The room was big and comfy and we had a balconny so in the morning we can relax and look at L.A waking up. The staff was very helpful of all the question we had about L.A. and the surrounding and even recommanded us to different great restaurant. Breakfast was a great healthy Californian morning meal, with fruits and nice pastry from a local baker. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and we would go back there anytime. We loved L.A. and wished we could've stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “In a Horror Movie”
Reviews.Author: gsophiaport54
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night at the Castle?..thank goodness..I had done much research to find a close/safe place to Hollywood Blvd./Walk of Fame - the castle seemed the best..when we arrived they said they had overbooked but they had a room in the "old" part..up the hill for FREE..so $200 a night to FREE..hmmm..the hallway had no doors..just a dirt hallway..safe?..the door had no Dead Bolt..safe?..the Gas stove was right by the door so if there ever as a fire..you would have to jump off the balcony..safe?( We were actually vacationing in Vegas at a beautiful time share with our friends) they got an old pullout couch to sleep on..great big silver fish bugs in the bathroom..needless to say I left all the lights on, the TV on, my clothers ON..and one eye open....to get down the hill to sightsee..we had to call the desk, we had to wait quite awhile until they found a van to send up..because we left so early the next morn, we drove to the Santa Monica Pier to see the ocean, the only plus..should I have offered more money?..the parking lot was full..so they must have really overbooked...

Reviews.Title: “Good view, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hollywood Hills Hotel for one night. We chose it for the location and the city view studio. The view was nice but not spectacular enough to outweigh the inconveniences. Pluses: great view but not breathtaking. We got the same view eating dinner at Yamashiro restaurant (same owner as HHH and Magic Castle Hotel) at the crest of the hill. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Adam seemed to be everywhere and to keep things right, and the lady who helped him was similarly helpful. Good sized bathroom but shower valve a little sticky. There were a stove, pots, pans, microwave, and toaster for those who plan long stays. Good sized bathroom. Good towels, had tissue, but no note paper or pen. $1 charge for phone, but we were not charged. Good breakfast of orange juice, delicious croissants, cereal, yoghurt, hard boiled egg. Don't miss the croissants. Free wireless is available in lobby of Magic Castle Hotel down below. They also will print from the Internet gratis. Free pick up and drop off between your room and Magic Castle. minuses: We can't blame a hotel for having boorish guests, but thin walls means you stay up late with stay-up-late guests. At 1 a.m. on one side of our room, there was a lady with a frequent annoying laugh. On the other side, there was constant reshuffling of furniture--maybe on the deck because rooms are carpeted. No wireless in rooms, but wireless throughout Magic Castle Hotel, below.

Reviews.Title: “Homely Hollywood Hills Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sharc84
Reviews.Content: Firstly you check into the Magic Castle Hotel. The HHH is up a road behind the hotel and they provide a free shuttle. We were staying in room 401 and we had a city view and also a hill view. The only pity was we didn't have a balcony so couldn't sit out and enjoy it - there was a screen over our window. The studio apartment is fantastic - nice big comfy bed, sitting area and seperate kitchen and bathroom. We had a problem with ants around the bath tub in but we didn't say anything - we used just put boiling water on them ourselves. We went to the pool one day for a few hours - you could not use the pool though as it wasn't clean and there was a layer of dirt or scum on the water. We enjoyed relaxing on the loungers however. If you want to use the pool you can use the Magic Castle hotel which is heated. The hotel is very near Hollywood Boulevard - Grauman Chinese Theater and the Walk of Fame. We found that you really do need a car in LA - the distances are just so big and I don't think public transport is that great. I really liked the Grove Shopping Centre and the Farmers Market. We also went to the beverly Centre for some more shopping. Went to see a The Late Late Show with Craig Ferguson in CBS studios, went to Santa Monica beach, Universal Studios which was only about 10 min drive away, Six Flags and also to an LA Lakers game in the Staples Centre which I would highly recommend. We also did a Starline tour of the Stars Homes. LA is a crazy place - not what I expected but I really enjoyed it there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: djs13
Reviews.Content: We didn't have a car when we went to Hollywood (we wanted to see if it was possible to survive without one) and, as a result of that, the staff was always willing to get us from our suite. They're all very hospitable, friendly and accommodating. I would go back! It's cheaper than the Magic Castle Hotel and you STILL could book at the Club/Restaurant (which is normally very hard to get into). Also, our suite was spacious, affordable (especially for Hollywood!) and clean. :-) What more could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Hollywood Hills”
Reviews.Author: lisa_the_librarian
Reviews.Content: A huge balcony overlooking a panoramic view of L.A., a large, clean room with a full kitchen, a coin-operated laundry room, friendly & helpful staff, free munchies, free bottled water & soft drinks, complimentary breakfast â€“ whatâ€™s not to like? Donâ€™t be put off by the complaints about the parking charges â€“ itâ€™s well worth paying. You wouldnâ€™t want to leave your car on the street and then have to trek up the hill every time you go to your room (itâ€™s really quite the hill). But donâ€™t expect the Ritz: itâ€™s not the Ritz and doesnâ€™t proclaim to be â€“ itâ€™s just the best deal you can get for your money if you want a comfortable, clean, safe place to stay in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but dated - excellent location”
Reviews.Author: StuMoz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Hills hotel for three nights at the end of a two week California road trip. Finding the Hotel: At the beginning of your stay at the HH Hotel, you must check in at its sister property, the Magic Castle Hotel. Like other reviews, my wife and I plugged the Magic Castle into the sat nav, and ended up at the door of the (associated) Maigicians club next door. The valet there was very polite and pointed us in the right direction. There is a short term (10 mins) space to park right outside of the reception. Arrival: We received a very friendly greeting from the lady on the front desk and our booking was confirmed. Whilst waiting, a guy came up and offered us a flute of traditional lemonade, which was a nice touch and much needed after a long drive to LA. Another guy came around 2 minutes later with chocolates for us. The receptionist informed us that we were in room 504 - her favourite. We were given two room keycards and a seperate key for the swimming pool. You also get a keycode to enter into the gate of the car park, along with a tag to hang on the rear view mirror - failure to do this might result in you getting towed. Location: Be warned that it is quite a steep hill up the the HH Hotel from the Magic Castle - about 0.25 miles. Overall the hotel is well located - we (like seemingly everyone else in LA) drove everywhere, so the hill didn't bother us. Once down the hill, Hollywood Boulevard is close by and an easy walk. You are also at the right end of town for Universal Studios/Warner Bros etc, only a 10-15 mins drive away. Breakfast is complimentary and served in the Magic Castle Hotel. We started walking down the first morning, but could not find a path, and didn't fancy the steep walk up the road, so went and took the car instead - there may be a path that we failed to find, but what looked like stairs down from the pool area ended in an abrupt halt where at some point the road had carved across them! If you do take the car to breakfast you can park (check the hours) for free in Orchid Avenue just down from the Magic Castle. We didn't ask, but the Magic Castle Club is closed in the morning and has a huge car park so you may have been able to park there too. Someone else on Trip Advisor mentioned that the staff will run you up the hill if required - this is good, but was neither advertised nor mentioned to us. The Room: First impression was that this is a decent sized room. Think more studio flat than hotel room. As you come through the door, there is a kitchen area with breakfast bar, cooker, fridge, microwave and sink. Part of our reason for choosing the HH was the kitchen facilities. After 2 weeks on the road, we actually longed for some home cooking rather than eating out. We were very disappointed by the equipment in the kitchen - one tiny saucepan, a small frying pan, plates, cutlery and.. that's it. Not even a tin opener, no over tray or gloves. There was washing up liquid and a sponge, but no tea-towel to dry anything. In general the kitchen area was tired and could do with a refresh. It was adequate, but could have been better. The bed was large and comfortable, linen was clean. There was a couple of armchairs and a side table in the living area, as well as a TV. We don't go on holiday to watch loads of TV, but the TV reception was generally poor. Plenty of channels though. Again, the living area is a little tired feeling - old carpet, worn fittings etc. The bathroom contained a bath/shower, sink and WC. All were clean enough, but all were old. Think of this more as a dated motel rather than a modern hotel and it is fine. There is air-conditioning via an old in wall unit - noisy but effective. The highlight of the room is undoubtedly the balcony - or rather the view from it. The balcony itself was a bit crusty and in need of renovation/decoration, but there is a great view over LA downtown and over the Hollywood Hills. It was great to stand out here at night and watch the city go by. Breakfast: The complimentary breakfast was good. Yogurts, bread/toast, cakes/muffins, cereal, juice and coffee. All good and all just right to start the day of well. Parking: There is secure parking right outside the accommodation block. One thing we found annoying was this: each room has an allocated parking space, clearly marked with the room number. Given this, why does the hotel charge an extra $10/night (+ taxes) for guests to park here? If you weren't parked here, the space would be sat empty. You need to display your pass in the car when the car is parked or you'll be towed, plus you need a code to get in the electric gates, so you can't get around it. One of my personal pet hates is unnecessary car park charges by hotels. Facilities: HH has a laundry - $1 for a wash or dry, $0.75 for powder. Last wash has to be in by 21:00 in the evening. There's an ice machine and drinks vending - $1 for a can of soda which is actually good compared to most hotels. There is a very nice looking swimming pool. We never found time to use it, but it did look good. There are sunbeds around the pool. There is wireless internet at the Magic Castle Hotel and also an internet 'booth' in the courtyard area by the MC pool. Overall: I have to say that I hadn't intended this to be a negative review. Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the HH Hotel and would recommend it to anyone. The staff there were superb. The receptionist asked my wife how the room was, and when the reply was "it was fine..." she seemed genuinely concerned by this. We had the best view in the house in our room and that made the experience really. In writing this review however, I am trying to think about how I would feel about the room as a stand-alone entity, ignoring the awesome views. The rooms and fixtures and fittings are dated, but they are clean and everything we used worked fine. We paid over $200 a night including parking, so for that price I would expect more. Without a car, I'd personally not want to stay here. The views and general location, plus the excellent, attentive staff are what pulls this up from average to above average. Rating the room on its own, I'd say 3/5 at best.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Janey3
Reviews.Content: With my partner I have just returned from an eleven night stay at the Hollywood Hills Hotel, beginning on 16th September 2008 and can say with all sincerity both of us were more than happy with all aspects of the hotel and its service. Believe me, I am the type of person who tells of a situation exactly as it is and if I wasn't happy about an issue would speak out but in the case of the Hollywood Hills I had nothing at all to be unhappy over. Check-in for the Hollywood Hills is at the Magic Castle Hotel and from the second we arrived to the second we left the front desk staff couldn't do enough to assist us and made us feel completely welcome. The Hollywood Hills is located (obviously) on a hill behind the Magic Castle. The distance to the Hollywood Hills is perfectly walkable and although a little steep is pleasant, taking around only 10-15 mins at a steady pace. We walked most days, without any problems and found the walk great for excercise, but for anyone unwilling or unable to make the walk the Magic Castle staff are always more than happy to drive guests the distance - at any time of day or night. A drive can be requested to or from the hotel just by asking at the foyer or picking up the phone in your room. As for the hotel itself, let me firstly point out the amazing views of LA it has to offer. We took a studio city room (room 404) and it had the most fantastic, extensive view over the city, right to downtown. It also had a gorgeous view of the Hollywood Hills (see my pics). Sitting on the balcony watching the sun rise and fall over LA is something I will always remember. The room itself was a decent size, clean, tidy and perfectly acceptable. There was a good size private bathroom, with the bath, sink area and toilet kept in pristine condition. The shower was powerful, a good tonic after a long day. **Please note - the TV worked fine and had more than enough channels for someone taking a vacation** The bed was the most comfortable of any I have ever stayed in at any hotel. It was huge! No chance of my partner kicking me in his sleep - he wouldn't make contact! The kitchen area was also clean and well stocked with cooker, fridge, microwave, grill, pots, pans and even washing up liquid. The location of the hotel is very quiet, away from the citys' noise but is ideally located for Hollywood Boulevard. The walk from the Hollywood Hills to street level is much shorter and attractions such as Graumann's Chinese Theater and the Hollywood and Highlands shopping mall are minutes away. The hotel is also ideal for travelling elsewhere in LA. Bus services run from Hollywood Boulevard to pretty much everywhere and the fare is just $5 for an all day pass. Also, the Metro tube is at the side of the Hollywood and Highlands Mall, running directly to Universal Studios and so forth. Each morning, a complimentary breakfast is provided at the Magic Castle between 7 and 10am, consisting of fresh pastries, cereals, yoghurts, bread, juice and teas/coffees - all are delicious. During our stay we were also given bottles of water, chocolate and other goodies, free of charge, given with a smile! The staff are so genuinely friendly and helpful. Any queries are dealt with instantly, they even printed off directions and bus times to local attractions for us as well as checking in on line for our flights home and printing our boarding passes. The hotel also has a laundry room open until late, where wash powder can be purchased for a small price. The Magic Castle offers use of its' pool and sun loungers at any time and staying at either hotel gives access to the Magicians' club just next door. At the side of the Hollywood Hills is the Yamashiro restaurant. From the restaurant there are the most spectacular panoramic views of the city, well worth walking the two minutes to photograph. All in all I do not have a bad word to say about this hotel. If you are looking for great value ($159 per night for a studio city room) a stunning view, comfortable, clean accomodation, friendly service and close proximity to Hollywood Boulevard, this hotel has it all. If you expect pure J Lo style luxury and 100% modern and expensive fixtures and fittings or are upset at the thought of a daily walk up and down a moderately steep hill you may need to look elsewhere. For everyone who does book, you should not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: planetrock
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Hills Hotel is actually part of the Magic Castle Hotel and Club, having initially driven into what we believed to be the entrance, we actually ended up at the Club entrance and were directed to the building next door. The staff at the club were friendly but the signs were mis-leading. We arrived a day earlier than planned in LA and they were happy to accommodate the extra night. This part of the hotel actually consists of rooms in a gated enclosure at the top of a hill and although not walkable if you wish to leave your car outside your room, the staff will happily drive you up and down to your room as and when you request. The staff were extremely helpful and could not do enough to help but were equally run off their feet. Although not a huge place there were a maximum of two members of staff evident at any one time and with a couple of people waiting at reception and a request for some guests to be driven about, we really felt that the staff were coping extremely well under pressure and despite people waiting, their attention faultlessly remained with the people they were dealing with . Our room had the 'Wow' factor when we walked in and we had a great view of LA, however on closer inspection the room itself unfortunately lacked attention to detail, there was paint flaking off the wall in the bathroom, the bathroom tap dripped constantly, some of the handles were broken on the cupboards in the kitchenette. The shampoo and conditioner were not replaced on the second day and the towels were not always clean. That said, this in no way detracted from our overall enjoyment it was just quite disappointing to see, on account of how good everything else was. The hotel was literally a couple of minutes walk from Hollywood Boulevard and the Metro station. It had great views from the hills and an independent restaurant at the back of it. An excellent continental breakfast was included in the price and consisted of a variety of bread, pastries and cereals, fresh fruit and yoghurts and was far superior to the any of the other 'complimentary breakfasts' available throughout our trip to California. The hotel itself may not be the fanciest in Hollywood but was great value for money, ideally located and the parking was very secure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views and outstanding location.”
Reviews.Author: chipmcdouglas
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Hills Hotel are actually apartments rented out by another hotel that i originally wanted - the Magic Castle. But i think i ended up with the much better option, because for a few quid more i had AMAZING views over Hollywood and downtown LA, in actual fact we overlooked the Blvd, the Capitol Record building, and could see right up to Griffith park and the observatory. So we had awesome sunsets, and sunrises every day for the first hotel of our honeymoon. The check-in, and general hotel logistics are a bit 'fiddly' to negotiate, quite quaint in a way - but definately worth it if you don't mind the hassle - for example the apartments are right at the top of a steep hill, with tricky access on foot - so the Magic Castle staff- and they were very glad to do it, would ferry us back and forth up and down. which was fine since they're very chatty and love telling you about LA - as do all the staff. It also seemed guests were able to use all the Magic Castle facilities, like breakfast ( bagels etc) pools and free snacks and drinks (Vey handy!!) Local residents share the complex and seem nice enough. The location, apart from the views, was excellent - 1 BLOCK! from Graumanns Chinese Theatre & Hollywood and Highland. From here we took the metro downtown one morning - very quick, cheap and SAFE! Apparently Hollywood has cleaned itself right up now too - we wandered round happy and unmolested. Be prepared and do a bit of reading up - which you are now!! the experience we had was definately worth the trouble. If you don't like the eccentricity of it all, pick a holiday inn instead.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & great location!”
Reviews.Author: mjayBoston
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because of the location to the Hollywood attractions and also the reviews on Trip Advisor and I was not disappointed. I travel on a budget so the price of $190 per night (that includes the state & hotel taxes of 14%) was more than I wanted to pay but I discovered that the hotel was well worth it. The hotel sits on a hill that overlooks Los Angeles so we had a great view of the city and even could see the Hollywood sign. I especially enjoyed looking out our balcony & viewing the city lights at night. Our room was equipped with a full kitchen, though small but it had everything: microwave, frig, stove, coffee maker, and even plates, cups, & silverware. There was a mini living room with couch, chair, and TV & a small spot for a table to eat our meals. The cozy bedroom had another TV & with a soft duvet on the bed & the bed was roomy enough for 1 adult & 2 teenagers. The bathroom had double sinks & the tub was equipped with water jets to take a relaxing bath. The hotel is linked with the Magic Castle hotel that is down the hill & that's where we ate our continental breakfasts. We could use the pool at the Magic Castle but found it to be small & always crowded with kids. So we swam in the bigger pool at our hotel. In fact, we were the only ones in that pool which is surrounded by a waterfall & Japanese garden next to a classy Japanese restaurant. Because we were up on the hill & away from traffic, our stay at the hotel was quiet & peaceful. Check in is at the Magic Castle hotel & I was greeted with a bubbly lemonade drink while I registered. We were shuttled up the hill to our hotel in the hotel's Toyota Highlander car. I was told that the lobby is open 24/7 and the shuttle car between the 2 hotels is always available to bring you back & forth. Also at any time, you can request a nice variety of free snacks. I would give this hotel an excellent rating if not for the fact that the furniture is worn, the carpet had stains & the walls could use fresh paint. Luckily past reviews on Trip Advisor prepared me for that. I felt that the hotel had a quirky charm that was enhanced by the curvy scenic drive up the hill; complete with a friendly neighborhood cat roaming the premises. Overall, this hotel far exceeded my expectations & the service was fast & friendly. The hotel is within walking distance to attractions, entertainment, restaurants, buses & I felt safe to walk around at night. I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ptype
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend at the Hollywood Hills Hotel (which appears to be operated by Magic Castle) for a week in August. It was a bit tricky to find at first because the actual rooms are up on the hill enclosed behind a pin-code protected gate and the main office is located at the bottom of the hill on Franklin street. Once we figured that out and checked-in, we received the password to open the gate and also given our own reserved parking space, which is later added to your bill at $10/day. The location was very convenient since itâ€™s a few minutesâ€™ walk to all the main attractions on Hollywood Blvd, such as the Chinese Theatre, Kodak Center, Walk of Fame, etc. It is a very safe location because itâ€™s up on a quiet residential hill, and especially because the rooms and parking are enclosed within the secure gates. The room was very spacious with fast acting air-conditioning. King size bed and a sofa bed, kitchen with stove, refrigerator, microwave, coffee machine, cups, plates, etc. The bathroom was good, with the exception of several ants which could be found crawling around everyday. This hotel location is also somewhat historical which we soon discovered when a tour we were on brought us here. Mainly due to the Yamashiro restaurant and its history http://www.yamashirorestaurant.com/history/ There is also a nice view of the Hollywood sign and the city. They also had complimentary breakfast and a pool at the main office, but we had no time for that. Too much to see and do in Los Angeles. Be prepared for a workout if you decide to go for walks instead of taking the car. The walk back up the hill to the gate is a very steep one. Apparently they offer free shuttle service but I donâ€™t think itâ€™s worth it. Only takes a few minutes to walk up and you get to burn a lot of calories in the process. My friend a I lost a considerable amount of weight during our stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location , great value”
Reviews.Author: BristolCoventryKid
Reviews.Content: Just back from our vacation and HHH was the first hotel we stayed at. Have to say the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the views from the hill were fantastic and the location was perfect. One block from Hollywood Boulevard - back home here in the UK this would have meant having to pay considerably more. Ok the rooms were basic, but clean and tidy and the laundry was changed daily. When we booked the hotel we were looking a place that was convenient, clean, provided somewhere to sleep, wash and hang our clothes - and HHH achieved all of these. The free shuttle service to and from our room was unexpected, and the free mini-bar items - crisps, chocolate, bottled water, soda etc (ok so you have to go down to Magic Castle reception, but no real problem) was another pleasant surprise - and both at no extra cost. If you want great customer service, a great location at a great price then HHH could be just what you're looking for..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with home comforts!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyDeeelite
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hollywood Hills Hotel and it was a very nice place. The views were fantastic, though the walk up to the hotel can be a bit taxing (they do offer a shuttle but we needed the exercise!) The room was clean and had a nice little kitchen (with dishes and cookware, as well as a microwave.) The bed was very comfy (with a nice view of the Hollywood Hills.) The balcony was HUGE and we enjoyed out coffee every morning with a few hummingbirds flying by. They do offer a continental breakfast (scones, toast, juice) which is nice. I wish they would have offered Wi-Fi in our room but it is only available in the Magic Castle Hotel (by the way, this is where you check in for the Hollywood Hills Hotel and also were they offer the continental breakfast.) The hotel is near Hollywood Boulevard and the Highland/Hollywood Metro Stop.
